file_content.text: We're setting incendiary charges. Don't be here when they detonate.
Don't look so surprised. It's our job to follow people.
Agent Diyaz planted a tracker on you back at headquarters.
Standard operating procedure. No offense intended.
Maybe some. My nose still hurts.
Seemed only fair after you mind-tricked me.
Would've been here sooner, but getting into Imperial territory without a lightsaber is complicated.
Glad I don't have to hold this base by myself.
Better late than never.
We won't be staying long.
Hope you have a plan for getting out.
Now you're stuck here.
Leaving's the easy part. We'll have a nice big diversion.
Where did you get these troops?
Who are the soldiers?
This is Blackstar Squad, a special operations team. General Var Suthra pulled in a favor with General Garza. Got them here quick.
We're demolishing this location; make sure the enemy can't recover anything useful.
Good. I'll stay and die with this place.
Galen? You've... changed.
I'm dangerous. I should be destroyed.
Inside, you're the same man you've always been. A hero.
Your life still has meaning.
The SIS looks after its own, Galen. We'll help you.
Just get me out of here.
The Sith did this to you, Galen. Make them pay.
Live for revenge.
With your training and... upgrades, you could inflict a lot of damage.
Don't know if I can live like this....
You have to. We need you.
Galen gave up the location of your field agents and the headquarters. He doesn't deserve to live.
I agree completely.
We need to debrief him first. Find out everything he told the enemy.
After that, if you want to die... I'll pull the trigger myself.
Lieutenant, prep this man for extraction.
Sir, I've located the Power Guard files--including notes on how the Sith controlled them. Orders?
That technology is too horrible to exist. Erase the data.
Destroy the whole project.
I disagree, but I'm ready to be done with this. Go ahead, Agent Diyaz.
I disagree completely, but I've learned better than to argue with you.
Copy the data. Send it to your superiors. Maybe we can salvage something from this.
Keep everything.
My sentiments exactly. We'll get the files out of here.
For once, we agree on something.
Plant bad data inside those files and leave them for the enemy to find.
Sabotage the enemy with it.
Let the Empire create its own Power Guards--but ones with a flaw we can exploit.
Considering what the enemy's done to us here, I'd love some payback.
Not surprised you're advocating dirty tricks--but in this case, I agree.
You should check in with General Var Suthra. We'll be right behind you. Just need to plant the incendiary charges.
It was interesting working with you. Good luck.
I'd say it's been a pleasure, but.... Goodbye.
I warned him. I told Rieekan this base was compromised.
The chief's dead. They're all dead. What were those things?
They're like what I fought at the main lab, but more powerful.
Power Guards.
This location was secret. You had security--safeguards.
How did this happen?
They knew our passcodes and overrides. Took them only seconds to get down here.
Get your head on straight and help me.
Pull yourself together.
There's nothing we can do. They'll find us--kill us.
You kept us out of the loop. Hid the Power Guard facility. Never told us about these weapons!
We stayed--supported your mission when we should've evacuated. These deaths are on you.
Lashing out at me isn't useful. We need to confront this together.
Anger isn't helping.
I agreed with you about evacuating. Your superior overruled us.
It was Rieekan's call.
He was incompetent. I should've been in charge months ago.
Your superior made the decision to stay, not me.
It was Rieekan's call.
You're a Jedi. You should've made him listen.
If you want to yell at someone, call Var Suthra. He authorized the project.
Blame the general.
Everyone responsible for this should be brought up on charges.
With Rieekan dead, I'm acting bureau chief. This operation's over.
Agent Diyaz, we're leaving now. Sorry, friend, but you're on your own.
Chief Rieekan promised to unlock these Imperial files.
Help me decode this datapad.
Then take it up with him. His body's over there.
Wait a minute... this Jedi is the only person who can stop those things.
I gave you an order, agent.
And I lost my hearing during the fight. Give me the datapad. I'll do my best.
You don't want to leave. You want to see this through.
[Force Persuade] Stay.
I don't want to leave. We should see this through.
Oh, so it's alright for you to mess with people's heads?
Jedi = confused angry agent // Tactic = ethical?
We don't have time to reason with him.
It's an emergency.
Help me decrypt this Imperial datapad.
Let's get back to work.
I do what I have to--and I don't apologize.
Mind your own business.
Sir, you should sit down. I'll handle this.
Good, good. Give the Jedi anything she needs. Carry on....
Good, good. Give the Jedi anything he needs. Carry on....
I know what a mind trick is. Don't do that to me. Hand over the datapad.
Sorry, friend, but I'm in charge here now.
You aren't leaving. [Hit him]
Well, that's one way to end a conversation....
We don't have time for debates.
Had to be done.
You're not helping, Kira.
Be quiet, Padawan.
It's the perfect response for uncooperative people.
My favorite way, in this case.
Jedi = feeling alright? // Actions = irrational
Lives are on the line. Just doing what has to be done.
Don't worry, Teeseven.
It's complicated, Teeseven. Trust me.
I'll explain later.
Stay out of this. I know what I'm doing.
Pipe down, droid.
Agent Diyaz? Decrypt this Imperial datapad--right now.
Uh, y--yes. I'll get right on it.
Decryption complete. The enemy took everything from the Power Guard lab to a fallback position.
I recognize these coordinates--an Imperial-controlled factory on the industrial level.
I couldn't have done this without your help.
Good work, agent.
Not like I volunteered. Just didn't want to end up like Special Agent Tander.
You say that like I had a choice.
Make those scum pay for what they did to us.
What's the Empire doing with a factory on Nar Shaddaa?
Why there, I wonder?
The enemy is manufacturing all kinds of war materiel--weapons, armor, shields.
Stars only know what they're doing with the Power Guards.
The Sith must be churning out new Power Guards from that location.
Power Guard central, now.
That factory has all the weapons, armor and shields they'd need to do it.
Why... why are we still here? Could swear we decided to leave....
Evacuate the facility, both of you.
You did.
You're obviously not well. Your friend here will take care of you.
Agent Diyaz will help you.
Head's pounding like a vibrohammer. Must've taken a hit during the fight.
You're confused. No one's leaving until this mission is complete.
[Force Persuade] Wrong.
I'm confused. We're staying until this mission is complete.
You hit me. I can't believe you actually hit me!
I shouldn't have done that. Please accept my apologies.
I'm truly sorry.
If I refuse, you'll probably just hit me again.
You weren't listening to reason. Agent Diyaz was more cooperative.
There was no choice.
What kind of Jedi are you?
If you know what's good for you, shut up.
And I'll do it again.
But... I... all right.
You have your information. The rest is up to you.
I'm sorry for keeping you here. Find someplace to hide until this is over.
Get to safety, agent.
This is a chance to strike back at the people who killed your men.
You're not coming?
I have no intention of winding up like them.
What would you people do without me?
It always is.
Think you run the galaxy, don't you?
Sir, I recommend we inform General Var Suthra--we need immediate reinforcements.
I've marked the enemy's fallback position. Good luck down there.
Take this with you. May come in handy....
Let's go, Agent Diyaz.
The sooner you raid that main lab, the sooner we can all relax.
This plan of Rieekan's had better work.
If Agent Galen was captured and tortured, it would explain how the enemy knows about us.
We've lost more field agents. Your operation's costing us everything.
Chief Rieekan's in charge here. Report to him.
Your identity's on file with us.
